edu.internet2.hopi.dragon.narb
Class NARBClient

java.lang.Object
  edu.internet2.hopi.dragon.narb.NARBClient

public class NARBClient
extends java.lang.Object

Class used to issue requests on behalf of the application to a NARB server. An example request is one asking for a path between two endpoints. The client does not currently support the NARB-to-NARB requests that are used for path authorization.

Author:
Andrew Lake (alake@internet2.edu)

          Constructor that accepts the hostname of the NARB server and the TCP port number on which it is running
 
Method Summary
 java.lang.String getHost()
          Returns a string representation of the currently set host address of name that represents the location of the NARB server

          Submits a request from the application to the NARB server and returns the NARB server's response.

          Set IP Address or DNS name that represents the location of the NARB server
 void setPort(int port)

Constructor Detail

NARBClient

public NARBClient(java.lang.String host,
                  int port)
Constructor that accepts the hostname of the NARB server and the TCP port number on which it is running

Parameters:
host - A String representation of either an IP address or DNS name used to identify the NARB server
port - The remote TCP port on which the NARB server is running
Method Detail

sendRequest

public NARBReply sendRequest(App2NARBRequest request)
                      throws java.net.UnknownHostException,
                             java.io.IOException
Submits a request from the application to the NARB server and returns the NARB server's response.

Parameters:
request - An object representation of the request parameters
Returns:
an NARBReply object representation of the NARB server's response
Throws:
java.net.UnknownHostException - thrown when unable to connect to the NARB server becaus ethe host is not recognized
java.io.IOException - thrown when there is an error reading or writing to the socket connected to the NARB server

Returns a string representation of the currently set host address of name that represents the location of the NARB server

a string representation of the NARB server host name or address
